Reviews.Content: I had my sister's Kindle Fire (older version) after she passed away.  So I decided to get one.  This was on sale and supposed to be better.  However, even after problems with my wi fi have been cleared up I still am having freeze up problems when I play a game - sometime after I have slid bar to unlock, I can't go any farther.  I have tried rebooting but it still is freezing.  The tech says my wi fi (DSL) is not strong enough, however I do not have these problems on my Nook.

Reviews.Title: Hdx
Reviews.Author: martin
Reviews.Content: I bought the kindle for my boy for Christmas, and we all love it, picture quality is great compared to the iPad, price is good to, bought it on cyber Monday

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire hdx is great
Reviews.Author: co
Reviews.Content: My daughter loves her new Kindle. I am so glad we bought it for her. The color is amazing and the sound is great. She has so much more storage space. I give it 5 stars for sure.

Reviews.Title: Great buy for the value
Reviews.Author: Justin B.
Reviews.Content: It isn't as fluent and seamless as the newer Ipads but for the cost you cant beat it. I can see Kindle being very competitive as far as functionality in the next model or two. If they can do this and keep the cost down, the market is theirs.

Reviews.Title: 16g not enough to download hd movies!
Reviews.Author: MRL
Reviews.Content: Very good device otherwise,but unfortunately they don't tell you that 16 g (really 12gig due to internal system requirements) is not enough to download a movie in hd. Otherwise a v good device for a commuter who likes to watch a movie while traveling to and fro work each day,display is exceptional.

Reviews.Title: Disappointment
Reviews.Author: Chris Hedlund
Reviews.Content: I had high expectations for this device. I tried with all my power to like the Kindle. But in the end, I will be returning this device. The hardware is excellent, and the user interface is pretty good as well. But odd behavior kept occurring. The device once went into a boot loop while I was at work without a charger. It continuously rebooted all day long. Nothing I did would stop the boot loop. Finally when I got home and plugged it into the charger, it booted back to the UI. I also have been noticing the screen flicker at times. It's more of an annoyance than a problem. There are other odd things that I can't recall at the moment. But ultimately, it's the battery life that prompts me to return the Kindle. Fully charged at 100% and left over night will find the device down to 88% without use. Then, when I pick the device up and actually use it, the battery is down to needing another charge within 1 or 2 (maybe 3) hours. Not heavy usage either, playing Candy Crush then browsing Facebook will do it. One time, I plugged the Kindle into charge before leaving for work, only to come home eight hours later and find that the screen was still on, and the device hadn't gone up 1% in battery charge. Another time, I plugged the device in for the night at 68%, went to bed and woke up to find the device charged only to 77%. Meanwhile, my Nexus 7 was at 14%, plugged in at the same time and was at 100% the next morning. I just can't have a device that I am constantly worried about keeping charged all the time. So, in the end, this device has been boxed back up and will be going back to Amazon. I hope to give the Kindle another try some time in the future.

Reviews.Title: Be careful with kids!
Reviews.Author: Mika McFadden
Reviews.Content: Kindle is great, the problem is that my 9 year old had instant access to 1-click purchasing and had ready spent over $100 on Amazon before I saw what was happening.

Reviews.Title: was disapointed
Reviews.Author: Robin Goutremout
Reviews.Content: I did not like the way the camera was. and also thought you could use a printer with it but could not do so..I am looking at the kindle fire hdx 8.9 but not sure if i will. the price is a bit high might have to go with adifferent tablet all together.

Reviews.Title: Good device
Reviews.Author: t schmoeger
Reviews.Content: Updated Review:The Kindle Fire works great for most things you can normally do on the internet, and it has clear sound and picture display. I bought the tablet so I could watch my television shows while I eat without having to hall around my laptop around. And for this purpose I would give the Kindle Fire a B+.After my initial posting, describing my disappointment with Kindles ability/or lack there of to watch free streaming media, Amazon reached out to me. Which really impressed me! They pushed out some updates to me, gave me pointers on how to ensure I am on the tablet version of common websites (since videos won't work on all of the regular sites), and ABC published an updated app for viewing episodes. Now I am largely happy with the Kindle's ability to watch streaming videos. The only downsides I have experienced is the Hulu is not available (you can access hulu plus but not the free site), the volume/sound projection abilities don't seem as good as some of my other devices (like my ipod), and you can only have one window/tab open at a time. So for instance if I want to check the news during a commercial you can't do it- which is a downside for me since I am a multi-tasker. However, I am largely happy with my purchase, and am definitely happy with Amazon's customer service!

Reviews.Title: I am totally satisfied with this product.
Reviews.Author: David P O'Bryan

Reviews.Title: Great device but lacking output/apps for external devices (TV, Receiver)
Reviews.Author: someone
Reviews.Content: There are many reviews for this device, but not much information about how to output the device display content to external TV/monitor. So, I'll share my experience with that part in case it could be useful for someone else looking for that functioanlity.I had this for few weeks, and basically can echo many other reviewers. Excellent build quality, display, Amazon apps. If you're planning to use this device just to shop, read, watch videos on Amazon (on Kindle display) I doubt you could find anything else even close. However, if you want to output the display or sound content to an external device like a TV it all starts to go downhill. I want to highlight these issues since I could not find any details on the web (except very few).For some reason, Amazon does not provide apps such as "Pioneer Control App" and "Panasonic Remote 2". These are essential for me to control my TV and receiver from Kindle, so I could use them as a workaround for at least playing my own music/video library. To make matters worse, there's no other display output (like DLNA, through the home network). Kindle does not have an HDMI port, and the USB port does not work as a "Slim Port". So, I tried the "Kindle Certified" NetgearPush2TV. A real dissapointing experience. I wrote a separate review for that. Apparently Amazon tech support (and Netgear support) does not know much about this (I spoke with at least 4 agenrts, if I remember correctly). All Amazon agents were great, but couldn't help. So, if you plan to use the Kindle for the following then you'll be dissapointed:1. Play music from Kindle to your networked (aka connected) receiver2. Play videos (from internet/Amazon Instant Videos and from your own library) from Kindle to a networked TV3. GPS (e.g. with CoPilot) --- Kindle does not have a GPS, which I realized after buying. My bad, not whining hereA modern high-end device like Kindle should provide this sort of basic functionality, in my opinion. I was surprised to learn these limitations (the hard way). There are apps for this sort of thing (e.g. Flips/iMediaShare) but they're far from perfection with many limitations. I tried very hard to keep the Kindle and find workarounds for the limitations mentioned above but I could not. So I had to return it.Since then I bought a Nexus 7. Only problem I have is that Amazon does not allow it to access Instant videos (I knew this before I bought it but still weird, because I can use any other device and don't see how Amazon makes money by blocking it. Kindle is really cheap, so, also hard to understand how they make lot of money by selling the hardware. So, I'm confused but there must be some reason other than just Amazon/Google rivarly). I don't watch videos very often (but my son takes care of that for me with his Kindle) so it's not a huge isue for me at this point.Again, you need to read this review very carefully since I did not attempt to highlight lot of good aspects of the device since others have already mentioned those; if the extra networking/navigation/output functionality is not needed for you then the Kindle is an excellent device.

Reviews.Title: Lovely little tablet. Really enjoying it.
Reviews.Author: Christine Hill
Reviews.Content: This is the first tablet I've ever owned so I can't really compare it to anything else out there on the market but I am enjoying my Kindle a lot. There is no way I could afford a new iPad and after using this, I don't think I would want one anyway. I use this primarily for reading, watching videos and movies, and occasionally surfing the web, so nothing terribly extensive. It suits my needs just fine, at a lower price point and makes me feel like getting an iPad would just be overkill for me. I purchased mine with the adds included and honestly it's not a big deal. They're not intrusive with whatever I might be doing on the tablet and if it bothered me that much I would just pay the $15 to have them removed. There are some deals that are exclusive to kindle fire owners which is pretty awesome and since I use amazon quite often for purchases, I don't mind a chance at snagging a good deal. There are plenty of apps to pick from (for my purposes anyway) like Facebook, Youtube, and a few games here or there. It's lightweight and easy to hold for reading while lounging around in bed and the movies I've watch show up in beautiful quality. I would definitely recommend a kindle tablet to anyone who is looking for a tablet for entertainment purposes but is hesitant to shell out the cash for one of the more expensive brands. Overall I am very happy with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: For a college student
Reviews.Author: jb231009
Reviews.Content: For the college student:I got this to replace my 2 crapped out laptops. As a 5th year student I really didn't want to (nor could I afford) a new laptop that will be replaced by a professional computer in a year or so. So, I thought on black Friday why not try for $180. I own the 2012 kindle fire and thought it was this seemed to be a good choice. I got a Bluetooth keyboard for this to make it a "real laptop", because I mainly write essays and it does well. I like this new kindle so far. I can type with a Bluetooth keyboard on word apps which helps a lot for the normal college student. I am not a tech geek or anything, just needed something to get me by for the last school year. I had a normal 15" laptop then a netbook that both died out in college so I really didn't want another expensive computer and this is a good replacement. I don't plan on this being a forever replacement and I don't think other people should either. I use it to type and play games on it. The kindle is really thin which I love. At first I was hesitant because I was fine with the 2012 fire but I needed something better to write essays on. Now I think this is new one is fine. Overall, if your looking for a basic tablet that can do things like write in polaris app (or in king soft, whatever) and play app games this does very well. If your looking for a tablet that is more photo sharing, personal details, bigger screen, etc this may not be for you. I haven't had a problem with it and advise a person to get Prime with it, you can download movies and watch them without internet (great feature).Down sides:Yes it's a kindle, you can't have a screen photo and they're adds but for the normal person thats not much a bothersome.The power button and a volume button are on the back of it. I find it a hard transition coming from old fire to the new one. It beats me why they'd put them on the back. I find the power button on back a little bit of an annoyance but new fire users may not. This also makes it an issue because if you have an old kindle fire you'll need to buy a whole new case and NO OTHER KINDLE FIRE CASES WILL FIT IT! (You have to specifically buy an HDX one). I bought one thinking they would but nope. Normal CASES cover the power button on back; I still use the non-fitting case because I don't want to spend more money on a case.It is only 7", no surprise there. But it is on the tiny side for tablets. I didn't mind in on the 2012 kindle fire and I don't now. If you have a giant cell phone it may seem odd because they're close in size but I don't have a high tech phone so this really doesn't bother me.This version does have a front facing camera, I don't know how many MP. I can't seem to find that info (but I haven't searched that hard). I tried it out and it's okay, prob like 3MP or so.

Reviews.Title: kindle number 2
Reviews.Author: munch
Reviews.Content: love all the extras! Wish I would have ordered larger screen. The HD is a great feature to have. Didn't realize the difference would be as good as it is from first kindle

Reviews.Title: Exceeded expectations
Reviews.Author: Myra P.
Reviews.Content: Love being able to read in the dark, watch movies with the best resolution I've seen. Very happy with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: My Kindle
Reviews.Author: Bretney
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love my Kindle. I'm having difficulty adjusting to it though because I'm used to apple products. Other than that, everything is perfect. :)

Reviews.Title: Love it! But no HDMI
Reviews.Author: Paige
Reviews.Content: I love my new kindle fire so far, picked it up today. I was bored of Apple and don't really love the layout of Android, so this was perfect. Still runs Android but has it's own fun look. So far it's really fast while web browsing and watching videos and the screen display is beautiful. Only negative thing I've found so far is that there is no HDMI port. You either need a 2013 Samsung Smart TV for "display mirroring" or you need to drop at least $60 on a Miracast dongle. Bummer since I was planning on using it to watch movies on it through my TV.Overall though, love my new tablet! Great bang for your buck.

Reviews.Title: The best I have used so far
Reviews.Author: Rex
Reviews.Content: This is a really nice machine, responsive and easy to use.  I have only two complaints, it will not allow you to download Google play apps and you cannot add or remove memory such as the memory cards used on cell phone or other tablets.  With the use of the cloud the memory thing still is a problem because you must pay for using the cloud if you have very much to store.The apps that are provided on Amazon are only the very basic and mostly for children.  It would be really nice to have some business apps such as access to my bank.  I use an app for the bank on my cell phone and it is quick and secure a real asset.Come on Amazon creep into the 21st century and be realistic about your marketing.Pay the $15 and get it without the special offers beleive me you will be much happier with  this unit.

Reviews.Title: My Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: Doug Hunsaker
Reviews.Content: I got this as a Christmas gift.  I love it.  Especially for reading books.  I love how convenient and light weight it is.

Reviews.Title: Love the Kindle Fire HDX7
Reviews.Author: Merry
Reviews.Content: Seen advertised on TV. I told myself, now that I would like. I ordered one and best money spent. I love it. It gives me exactly what I want. Have down loaded a book and found that really nice. The lighting it has and easy access to page turning. Yes I would recommend to all. My Mother-in-law got one and loves it also. Rating is top notch!

Reviews.Title: very nice
Reviews.Author: B. Tanner
Reviews.Content: I have been wanting one for years and have encouraged everyone else to get one, It of course came fast and is so easy to use, but could have come with instructions for newbies.

Reviews.Title: Great.
Reviews.Author: Daniel Peacock
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my two children (10 and 6), and they have not put them down since.  The picture is incredibly sharp. I am very happy with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: A 'solid' tablet PC that also is a great reader.......
Reviews.Author: Hellcat45
Reviews.Content: The Kindle Fire HDX is easy to use, is a nice size, and has a nice crisp color screen. It was easy to set up my e-mail; and, its "streams movies" effortlessly! I find the "help" (or Mayday) feature a real plus. I own an iPAD and it is a great tablet computer with the caveat that "you" must be somewhat computer-savvy to use it. The Kindle HDX is a great "reader" also......

Reviews.Title: Excellent tablet, great tech support
Reviews.Author: Leonard Filla
Reviews.Content: Clarity, speed, and fantastic tech support. There are plenty of apps available. In fact, I am using it to learn Spanish via one of the free apps.

Reviews.Title: Bought this for my parents for Christmas
Reviews.Author: Nicole Chernick
Reviews.Content: And they loved it. Came packaged well for protection. They are fully enjoying the awesome pixels and the portability of the tablet.

Reviews.Title: Definitely the "most bang for your buck"
Reviews.Author: T. Clifton "Techie Tony"
Reviews.Content: What's not to like? This is probably the best piece of hardware out there for the price hands down. I have 2 iPads, iPhones, iMac. I love the Mac environment and iOS.  The hardware is obviously quite expensive, but if you use the device even 1-2 hours a day I would pay the extra and get the iPad. If you don't use the device regularly or if you're an Amazon-o-phile and your whole world revolves around Amazon, the Fire is the only logical alternative IMHO.  I prefer my iPad in almost every way, but I like the small size of the 7" to carry to town, mall, church or whatever instead of hauling around the iPad. It's an amazing price, and that's the best feature about this device.  I love the nice PPI resolution, which makes me feel right at home while reading.  The speakers are the next biggest stand-out feature that I really love about the HDX.  The first time I sat down to watch a movie on it, the sound literally blew me away!  It made the movie twice as interesting to hear the amazing surround sound or perhaps even 3-D sound if that's possible, awesome bass, great range, nice to hear it coming from both sides of the device when in landscape mode, all things I would expect from the more expensive iPad, but dont find! Also plenty of power if it's anywhere near close enough to see the screen.  I just have to gripe about the Amazon tweaks and control of the Android OS that just doesn't feel as customizable or as intuitive as plain old Android OS or obviously iOS.  Again for my purposes of mostly reading books, and the occasional movie, or browsing, this environment is actually just fine, but not my first choice, perhaps after using it long enough I'll learn to actually appreciate it, we'll see.  I wish it could be thinner and lighter of course, but I'd rather have the longer battery life that it does have vs. being lighter weight, with technology where its at right now.  I'm thankful for the wake sleep feature with the right case. I love that it has BT where a lot of cheap tablets in this price range tend to leave it out.  So far I've found all the Apps in the Amazon App Store that are important to me, so the App limitations haven't really bothered me yet. They seem to have a really good selection.  I do like not having to worry about bugs or viruses by only using Apps that are patrolled by Amazon, kind of like Apple does. It gives me a nice feeling of security.  Over-all, I can hardily recommend the HDX to anyone that doesn't use iTunes, or have an iPhone or Mac.  And to those looking to just get their feet wet in the tablet experience using it only occasionally. If you plan to really be using it a lot, I would instead highly recommend paying the extra money to get an iPad mini or Air, it's well worth the extra investment.  However this is a great starter tablet for kids or to just dabble yourself a little bit to see if tablets are really all they are cracked up to be!  I didn't get on the tablet bandwagon for almost 2 years, thinking they were just a passing fad, and were terribly limited compared to netbooks... well, after I saw they weren't going away after all, I got one, and I have never regretted it since! Good luck! There's a lot of good tablets out there to choose from. I've even found the cheapest Lenovo ones are pretty awesome.

Reviews.Title: I love it.
Reviews.Author: susie sherwood
Reviews.Content: At first I wasn't sure but after I got used to the difference between the old one and the new one I love it.

Reviews.Title: A Wonderful little device!
Reviews.Author: Go Buckeyes "Maria"
Reviews.Content: I wanted to provide a review for those still on the fence about purchasing a Kindle Fire. Since they first became available, I had held off on purchasing a Kindle Fire. The new features on the HDX and the positive reviews finally moved me to make a purchase, and I must say I am very impressed! It was very easy and quick to set-up and your having exploring and having fun. I am considering enabling the parental controls to limit my time on it!I purchased the 7" because in my mind, I could not justify the jump in cost to get the equivalent 32GB in the 8.9 HDX fire. I also wanted something that would fit in my purse vs. having to carry something else around. I was a bit concerned about the ability to read text on such a small screen, but it really isn't an issue because the screen gives a very crisp picture and there is a magnify feature. Don't get me wrong, if you need glasses to read, you will still need glasses to read ;) I am very happy with the speakers for music and movies, etc.. You get a healthy volume with a quality sound that others in a room can easily hear.There are some neat features that I don't believe are advertised. One, is on the keyboard. There is a microphone symbol that when it is selected, transcribes your spoken word into text. Also, I was confused about whether a anti-virus or malware app would be required. The community forum had a number of conflicting opinions on the subject, so I chatted with kindle support. The representative assured me that the Kindle is already designed with all the security algorithms necessary. She added that there are apps available for anti-virus and malware if anyone wanted them. In addition, she advised me that the browser has a option called Security in the options menu, which will provide you a warning if you are about to Enter a potentially harmful site.Bottom line.... I love my Kindle Fire and I am looking forward to exploring everything it had to offers!

Reviews.Title: Best Fire as of yet
Reviews.Author: Reed
Reviews.Content: Great for reading, watching, listening to music and browsing. I have the old Kindle Fire and a Galaxy Tab 3, 10.1. Amazon did a great job with all the little extras they added to the HDX. If you have an old Fire a side by side comparison will have you loving the HDX. It is lighter,  faster, easier to maneuver around the system, the presentation/organization is cleaner, and the screen itself seems to keep off fingerprint smudges better. Another favorite is the ability to put books in collections. A set back on this ability is not being able to change the listing of the books within the collection's pop up window. The only available view is a grid view, and it's hard to see the books in this view.I would say that the volume output on the new Fire HDX is better than the Galaxy Tab 3. You can easily understand the conversation on videos and hear the musical notes on online radio as long as you don't become too picky about the notes. Picture quality is better than the Galaxy Tab 3 too. The colors are clearer, image is sharper, quite comparable to one of the better HD TV's on sale today. I was very surprised at discovering this. The TV we have takes quite a bit of power, now I just watch Netflix and Hulu on the HDX and get the same quality, less electric consumption, but not the big screen.Good battery life if all you're doing is reading or listening to music. Expect to plug it in more if you surf or watch videos. If you are planning to use it in sunlight, you'll need a lot of patience, but that is not the reason for buying the HDX. If most of your reading, watching and surfing activities are indoors, then you'll be fine.I bought a Fintie cover for it, the Fintie comes with 'buttons' that go over the HDX's existing buttons. These make pressing the power and volume buttons easier, and allows for better touch recognition too.Does it take the place of a laptop? Absolutely not. I do not believe any tablet will ever take the place of strong processors and lots of storage for people who 'work' on laptops. If all you want is an easy way to read, maybe watch something, listen to online music, or surf a bit, then this is for you.

Reviews.Title: Absolutely Love It
Reviews.Author: Michael Hernan
Reviews.Content: This is the first tablet I have ever bought & I can say that I am not displeased at all. With all this chat about the iPad being the best thing out there, I can say this tablet is just as good!

Reviews.Title: so far so good
Reviews.Author: T. J. Jones "ImaginaryFlowersUSA"
Reviews.Content: I update to the latest Kindle every year.  The HDX 7" is great with Wi-Fi.  I like the 64 GB and quad core processor.  The dual band wi-fi can use more power than my Internet can really deliver.  I will probably have to update my whole Internet package.  When I use the wi-fi to do downloads, everything on my wi-fi slows to a crawl and my Internet movies on Amazon and home computer freeze till it is done.  I think my phone company only offers 100 Mbps with my current package. This kindle is powerful and takes over my whole Wi-Fi service.The power adapter is a little different this year and goes in at an angle (thought it didn't fit).  The adapter comes with the Kindle.I will be keeping my old Kindle Fire HD, because I still enjoy it and some of the old apps I am not tired of yet (not compatible to HDX).  I will be able to upload more of my pdf's to this newer Kindle, because pdf's use a lot more space. Also I can download more TV shows and movies, since I live in the Amazon ecosystem.I like the clock on the screen is back. When I open the Kindle cover, the clock is in the corner with the date.  That was not on the HD, but was on the first Fire (it was bigger).I like the offers, because it is important to me what else is available.  The screen is beautiful as always. I did have to make some adjustments to brightness (using settings) and the books (using view) I am reading. Actually for us older folks, brighter is better.The sound is nice. I was watching PBS channel out in my yard and my neighbors could hear it. The PBS channel app  was not something I was aware of before, but loving it now (even with my Internet service).The HDX is smaller than the HD 7", but the screen is still the same size.The camera on the 7"HDX is better than the HD.  I really like it, because it comes with its own app, and I don't have to download a free app like last year. The one on my 7" HD has problems but was free.

Reviews.Title: WARNING!!!  WARNING!!!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Amazon has tweaked the android operating system to prevent using Google Chrome as a browser and to prevent using Google Drive as a cloud storage utility.  In effect then, you have to use the supplied browser and use Amazon's cloud storage.  They may work OK, but I am frustrated by not being able to use the systems I have been using for quite some time.  By the way, I am able to use all Google systems on my Apple iPad!!!  In retrospect, had I known what I now know, I would have bought a Nexus rather than the Kindle Fire HDX.All that being said, I guess it will work as a reading and music device so long as I am satisfied with the Amazon reader and music player - which I am since I use them on the iPad.

Reviews.Title: Awesome!
Reviews.Author: Baaaaaay
Reviews.Content: My first tablet.  It's fast.  Much faster than my HTC sensation 4g.  It also has amazing picture quality.  I also got Prime and have been watching shows almost every day.  It came already registered to me, which was convenient if not a little scary (I'm a privacy rights supporter).My favorite thing about it is the battery life.  I can go days without plugging it in.  I am not constantly on it, but I do use it for a few hours each day, about half of which is streaming shows.  I'm taking a trip soon and I'm stoked to have something I know will last the whole plane ride.Finally, the keyboard is great and the Swype works much better than it does on my phone.  It's very convenient for typing and entering information.All in all I'm am quite satisfied.  I'm writing this about a month after receiving this and have had quite a bit of play time on it.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for Me
Reviews.Author: Dennis Meehan
Reviews.Content: I bought my Kindle HDX for my son as a Christmas present. It is a terrific little machine and works flawlessly. The price is also unbeatable. It has enough apps to keep him busy and I appreciate the parental controls. We don't have any issues with the screen. I like it so much that I'm going to buy one for myself despite the high switching cost of a large iTunes music collection.

Reviews.Title: It Rocks
Reviews.Author: L. Cotman
Reviews.Content: It is very fast. The picture is gorgeous. I love it. I owned the previous version and this is a  very nice upgrade from that  one.

Reviews.Title: Love it!!!
Reviews.Author: Keionna Williams
Reviews.Content: I bought this Kindle for my son as a xmas present and now my husband and I can not stay off of it.  It's super fast, super clear and the mayday button is awesome. He loves it!!!! We all love it so much that my husband and I are both buying the Kindle fire hdx 8.9.

Reviews.Title: very good buy. a great ipad.alternative
Reviews.Author: Toreri
Reviews.Content: Great iPad substitute. I have a iPhone 5 and a iMac. I am also a kindle owner. I think the kindle fire's a great tablet for the money. My father has a nexus 7. After receiving the kindle as a Christmas gift, I realized that this version of android is much more user friendly for him than the native android app. The kindle is user friendly and offers ease of use without the cost of Apple. Mayday feature is brilliant. The speakers sound is pleasantly clear. The blue tint around the edge of the screen that otherscomplain about is barely noticeable.

Reviews.Title: Love my Kindle Fire~!
Reviews.Author: Frances Zoller
Reviews.Content: Love how convenient it is to have so I can look things up so quickly!  I don't go anywhere without it!

Reviews.Title: Awesome...yet semi-invasive.
Reviews.Author: Ellery Higgins
Reviews.Content: I purchased this for my wife for Christmas this year.  My one major complaint with the device itself is that (at the time I purchased it) there was a difference of $50 to not have the "Special Offers" lock screen.  It sounds cool on their site to have it anyway...but....they're just advertisements on the lock screen that take up the whole page.  Soo...instead of microtransactions inside of an app to get rid of ads, you have to pay $50 more to not have these on your lock screen.  Not cool Amazon...not cool.EDIT: I purchased this on a Black Friday sale, to clarify, it is no longer $50 difference in the devices for the ad/non-ad ones, but at the time, one was on a large sale and the other wasn't...making it a large price difference.Second complaint which is also the awesomeness of this product.  With the purchase of the Kindle Fire, Kindle Fire HD, and the Kindle Fire HDX, you get free 500 coins for the app store after registering it and adding billing information.  I completed this...and 0 coins.  Soo....being curious, I used the "Mayday" button on there to contact support.  Due to the friendliness of the agent that responded, I found out I was only like the 10th person to use it that morning, as it's still a new feature, and the agents are new to this too!  She was EXTREMELY helpful and kind and informed me it could take a couple hours to receive this promotional credit.Last but not least...the power cable.  It is at a FUNKY angle on the tablet in order to keep with the contoured angle of the tablet edge.  It angles upward while plugged in properly.  If not careful, I can see this charging port or cable becoming damaged easily.Beyond those few issues, this is an excellent tablet, it's perfectly sized, fits well in the hand, the screen is bright (I see none of the blue tint as others are describing), and the support is phenomenal!

Reviews.Title: A Christmas Gift She Loves
Reviews.Author: Happy Camper
Reviews.Content: My wife already had a Kindle.  I cannot remember whether I bought it at a Brick and Mortar place or through the Wonderful World of Amazon(tm).  It was an older, very lightweight model, in black and white and all shades in between.  She needs lightweight because of severe Rheumatoid Arthritis.  Anyway, it was time for an upgrade.  Since I have the Kindle Fire HD 7", HD Display, Wi-Fi and love it, the fact that the HDX was lighter and did more was a selling point.Although she's not used it much at this point, everything is what she wants.  It does weigh a bit more than her original Kindle, but it's a con she's willing to live with.

Reviews.Title: A great tablet
Reviews.Author: Shaun Kanak
Reviews.Content: I finally bought my first tablet.  Since we are long-time Amazon Prime customers, I wanted a tablet that would play Amazon Prime video as well as Hulu+ and Netflix.  And, of course, a good Kindle experience.  That narrowed the field to either iPad or Kindle Fire.  After the Fire HDX came out it was clear that Amazon had some serious hardware.  The latest Kindle OS helped sell me too.I do miss the Google apps that I have on my droid phone but fortunately some of them can be side-loaded if you find the apk file on the web.Reading books and graphic novels is a great experience.Watching videos (both streaming and saved to the kindle) is great.Sound quality is very good.I'm still getting to know the Free Time feature for my young kids but it looks promising.Bottom line...if you like to read (on a tablet) and watch video then you will have a hard time beating the Fire HDX and when you consider the price, there's no contest.  I'm so happy with my 7" Fire HDX that I bought the 8.9" Fire HDX for my wife and kids.

Reviews.Title: I LOVE IT
Reviews.Author: terri l. selvey
Reviews.Content: This little baby fits in my purse and does everything my laptop does and even more quickly.  I can evendo dictation on this for my job.  It's more lightweight than the Kindle Fire, which I also love.  I have 4 Kindlesand this one is rarely out of my reach.  I had to really look for the purple edges people were talking about,and with very close scrutiny I saw them, but then immediately forgot they were there.  Not an issue at all.For the price difference my only regret is that I got the 32 instead of the 64.  Maybe next year.  The camera,as some have said, is virtually useless unless you want to take pictures of yourself.  I don't want the bigger tablet because I like to be able to slip it into a regular-sized purse.  I hope someday they come out with a rear facing camera on the 7". I guess that would be my only disappointment, but from the reviews I knew that when I bought it so I still give it 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HDX 7" Review
Reviews.Author: Becki Rasmussen
Reviews.Content: I am liking my new Kindle so far very well, I had another Kindle that was 15 months old that would no longer charge or hold a charge. I have spoken with others that have had the same problem. I am just hoping the new Kindle lasts longer than the first one. I have purchased 2 other Kindles that are about 1 year old for my two grandsons and i hope  their Kindles last.

Reviews.Title: REALLY COOL!!
Reviews.Author: Les Mack
Reviews.Content: I LOVE it! I have a Paperwhite with 3g WI-FI and thisexceeds it by FAR. The 4 G Wi-Fi works reallywell, the images POP out at you from the HDX display it's almost like 3-d. The battery recovery timeis very quick.

Reviews.Title: Talk to the kindle, it listens.
Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer
Reviews.Content: I just updated from the original 7 to the new HDX version, and am glad I did. Overall it works better, faster, and so far no problems.It seems to have a bit longer battery life, but that could still be improved. Beautiful new screen image. One new feature though really impressed me. I found it by accident. Speech to Text is activated by a microphone button on the keyboard. It works amazingly well for me,  It was worth the upgrade all by itself. I spent in excess of $100.00 for a program for my PC, and have been disappointed with it. It is difficult to use, requiring many key strokes to get it going, not to mention the necessary use of a headset. The Kindle is very accurate in getting down what I say, not 100% yet, but closer than I can do with my fingers on the PC. Now, all I have to do is learn to speak in commas and periods. That unfortunately it can not do by itself. Just push the microphone button, keep your hand away from the microphone area, and talk.

Reviews.Title: Loving  it
Reviews.Author: Claudine Jancik
Reviews.Content: I  like  everything  about  the  Kindle Fire HDX. It  has  great  color ,  is easy  to  use and  I  can  read  anywhere  day  or  night,  which  was  my  primary  purpose in  buying it.

Reviews.Title: Better then my ipad2 but!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: kiracatto
Reviews.Content: I really like my kindle fire hdx more then the ipad2 for the size and weight and reading books, the blue outline doesn't bother me or interfere with my reading ,What I don't like is just like ipad you can't use outside apps without indangering your system, I wanted something that would let me use diffrent apps, I'm hoping that Amazon will add more apps I want, but all in all I love my kindle fire hdx and you can really see the diffrence when watching movies the graphics are wonderful.

Reviews.Title: Love it !
Reviews.Author: Linekin Lady
Reviews.Content: Just got the Kindle HDX and absolutely love it. Had a question about operation and within 10 seconds of clicking on the help icon, a live person pops up in a small window and answers my question in a quick and easy way. Great HD viewing, fast and so easy to use. Great vehicle also to use as a secondary device if your computer has issues and can't be used. Can easily cruise the net, check email, watch movies and of course read a book. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: love it and great amazon service
Reviews.Author: ShopsLot
Reviews.Content: we own a few tablets in the home...to give reference ipad air and mini retina on verizon, wifi ipad 4, note 10.1 samsung and now this kindle hdx.I do have to mention that my first hdx arrived but something was wrong with battery life both charging and usage. also one long side of screen had too much blue shadow.  I almost returned it but decided to give replacement a try with the great customer service rep on phone with amazon.  The 2nd one arrived and battery life is great. with some minimal use over the past week, still at 40%...awesome! Also the blue shadow much less on replacement kindle as well.I do love Amazon and actually love the special offers myself on my kindle but you can opt out when purchasing.  I love the speaker volume on the hdx for such a little tablet more than sufficient.  beautiful screen, browser works well and smooth.  plenty of storage with 64gb version...downloaded 3 x Harry Potter in hd but not biggest hd file from amazon library with still plenty of room left.  great for trips out and content in purse to keep entertained.  no, amazon App Store is not as vast nor as lovely as iOS but main things I use are there....Facebook, candy crush, pulse, things of this nature. I now love my free book a month from kindle lending library. I have a young child in home so love the kindle free time for her books so she can't switch to 50 shades series on accident...yes!  great for skype calls, I heart radio, fitbit tracking and mainly reading kindle books. with this kindle hdx...I will not be buying a second mini ipad retina in the home.  almost wish I got the verizon version though. happy purchase with the $50 off special.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Big H
Reviews.Content: This is my first tablet and I love it. Very easy to set up and use right out of the box. And I got a good deal on it. I would definitely recommend this to every one I know. Great item I cant say enough about it.

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: Marcia
Reviews.Content: My friend has one and he gave it to me for about a week. I loved it! Reading books will never be the same. It has wi fi, facebook and all that so I don't even have to turn my PC on. It would've been even better if it had more apps to choose from. Otherwise it's a great buy and the price is right!

Reviews.Title: Awesome entertainment device that's light in your hands
Reviews.Author: Ckk
Reviews.Content: Screen quality is amazing even though it flickers at time. It's so light that you can have it in your hand for hours either reading or watching videos. Simple access to Amazon ecosystem to buy more things or more kindle books.

Reviews.Title: I love my kindle but,
Reviews.Author: webbrat
Reviews.Content: I like to read for 5 or 6 hours a night sometimes longer if I can't sleep and even if I place the kindle on "airplane mode" I don't get that much time on my battery.  I really worry for when I am traveling and can't get to a place to plug it in. I also worry because my connection where one has to plug it to recharge is getting sloppy.  I really have move the cord around to get it to charge and then hope the air currents don't change it.  This happens with both the cords I own.  This is also the 2nd hdx I've had.  This one is only 3 weeks old and now it is starting up with problems.  So while I love everything about my kindle (I don't even mind the ads) I am really in a spot with what to do now. This is also the reason for four stars.

Reviews.Title: amazing
Reviews.Author: tony solino
Reviews.Content: Theirs no other tablet on the market that can top this one.  If you buy this tablet it would be the best investment.

Reviews.Title: WOW Kindle HDX is great and so is the help!
Reviews.Author: Brian
Reviews.Content: This Kindle Fire HDX is great. The performance far exceeds my expectations and the screen clarity is SUPER. The help line is great. But, the people manning the help line need a little more training. They couldn't help on a few problems, minor as they were!That was ok for now but, what if something major comes up?Other than that it is a great little tool and were having a good time using it. It's handier than a lap top.

Reviews.Title: kindle review
Reviews.Author: Jan Murray
Reviews.Content: Very happy with my new kindle. It does everything my friends iPad does but at a much lower purchase price. Still learning all the different apps available.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HDX is just as good as an iPAD
Reviews.Author: Tonia Randolph
Reviews.Content: This is my 3rd kindle.  There are so many great things I can say about the Kindle Fire HDX.  The upgrades just only get better and I highly recommend anyone to purchase this especially if you are a work-play type person on the go like I am.  I love all the game, business, book, and etc apps.  Amazon has very good deals on their digital apps/books.  Just make sure you get the protection plan to protect your toy and make the best of all the uses that this wonderfully created device has to offer.  I will forever be a kindle fan.  The price is within my budget.  I love it.  Keep the modern technology of the kindle fire HDX coming!

Reviews.Title: Very happy with it
Reviews.Author: Eric
Reviews.Content: Exactly what I was looking for display is beautiful and book selection, app selection and movies are great, thanks Amazon!

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: James
Reviews.Content: Great Display.  Books looked great,  and is lightweight.  Price is wonderful, battery last a long time. Thank you very much.

Reviews.Title: Love it.
Reviews.Author: Audrey Green
Reviews.Content: What can  I say about this Kindle Fire HDX is just what I have been looking for.  Love it and the special offers don't bother me at all.

Reviews.Title: awesome little tablet
Reviews.Author: jonathan Fisk
Reviews.Content: This is a great tablet that does it all and for a phenominal price. Its not too big and cumbersome. Easy to carry and android apps galore. Anyone who is considering purchasing a tablet should seriously consider the kindle fire series.

Reviews.Title: kindle fire hdx is an awesome product.
Reviews.Author: Andrew Kramer

IF Kindle had access to all the Apple 3rd party apps, due to the price difference, it would be game over.However for Netflix, and internet browsing its not even close. KFHDX is way faster. So yes, sometimes the experts are right!!

Reviews.Title: Genius Amazon
Reviews.Author: FreedomAndLiberty
Reviews.Content: This product is just awesome. If you want the simple Amazon Prime tool to shop,watch,listen...or need help.. just click mayday....This product actually builds my desire to purchase more from Amazon. Also if i want to install google apps it is possible. Seriously Amazon Prime is just the way to go for all your shopping needs. So ..it has a fast enough processor to game and complete tasks like surf or watch a movie. Oh yeah another big thing was....reading books...this thing makes it easy to read a book....Amazon Prime and this device just works and is a huge solution for many tasks just reach down and pick it up...only thing that I would like to see is Kindles offer more harddrive space....like a 1tb...yeah we are in a time of file servers aka cloud servers...but in times of no internet...a real harddrive is a must...face it 4G/3G is a hoax, its a joke when it comes to internet so don't fall for the 4G lie and highway robbery mobile internet companies charge for internet...Amazon seriously this product and your growing services is on the right track for the future. Just remember don't close off this device to just Amazon...that would be the end of Kindle. I wish I had the money to have several of these devices....sometimes i don't need the full pc desktop but have a certain need and this device makes it possible and does so smoothly very good device very good tool. Keep up the good work Amazon! Amazon has so much potential that could grow alot of business and create alot of jobs....Kindle HDX is worth having! And my boy loves it! I recommend this especially if you are a Amazon user. I used this product for 20+ days or so and I'm getting one for Christmas. Battery life could be better but so could the ram and harddrive...but for what I did the device was not a problem it actually was the solution for many many tasks.  I watched movies, streamed music, watched video, surfed, read articles and books, used the alarm and calender, used yahoo weather app, played games. The only thing i noticed as something it lacked was harddrive space when the Amazon prime video offered to download the movie better quality would require more harddrive space. But this is more of need when traveling through an area where there would be no internet or limited internet. And... Really... the only thing...lacking is my bank roll to buy constantly 24/7 on Amazon with this device..haha...I'm sure i could come up with negatives but this device really is a solution a tool that just works for me.

Reviews.Title: Finally, Amazon got this mostly right!
Reviews.Author: A. Wertheim "werthla"
Reviews.Content: I have the Kindle HD, iPad, and Surface 2 just for background.I have a lot of problems with HD in terms of its claim to being a tablet - the internet is very fussy, it's slow and is simply not reliable as a tablet.  But it's a great E reader.I wanted a good 7 inch tablet.  I bought a returned the Google Nexus 7.  It was great except for no browser having a reading pane which is important in a small tablet.  You would think Google would have this in Chrome but no.  The screen is the best in class.I went to Best Buy and they had the HD and HDX side by side.  I compared the internet and there was no comparison - they HDX was very fast so I bought it to try out.  Happy to report that this is now a true tablet in that the Silk browser is much improved,, the quad core makes all the difference, the internet is now very usable and fast.HDX also has improvements over the HD - you can slide up from the bottom to access recently used programs which is very important if you need to switch between apps since only Surface allows you to keep two apps open simultaneously in the tablet world.  This works better than iPad.A page from other androids - you swipe down to see email and other notifications.The power button is now accessible!Size is smaller and slimmer.Some have noticed that there is a purple haze to the background.  That's true and that's something you have to judge for yourself if it bothers you.There is a limit on the number of tabs you can open on the Silk browser.Battery life is improved over HD.  It now comes with a cable and wall charger.There is no rear camera.  If that's important to you, consider the iPad Mini.  OR you can buy a real camera for the price difference.In summary, there is really no reason to buy the HD unless the price is $100.  The HDX is now a good competitive tablet.  The app store remains a problem if you depend on apps for games.  I have found some surprisingly good specialty apps.This is smaller than the iPad Mini and almost half the price.  Unless you are trapped in the Apple ecosystem and need their apps, (there isn't much you can't get from the web sites) this is a good alternative.

Reviews.Title: Well, okay, 3.75 stars
Reviews.Author: Owen Murray
Reviews.Content: I'll preface this right now though: this could easily be a 4.75 - 5 star review. But before I get to what drags the score down for me, the good stuff about the Kindle Fire HDX:- Clearly more than a reader.  The hardware in this is powerful and easily high up comparative to other tablet-like device of this size.- Battery life is great so far.- Fantastic screen quality; reading, browsing the internet, using apps like netflix, tumblr, etc., all look fantastic- Sound is also very good, headphones and speakers both- Ads are very unobtrusive (if applicable to your kindle), only appearing on the unlock screen.- Like advertised, works straight out of the box (obviously if you have linked a previously existing amazon account to the kindle)- Big name apps from the amazon store work perfectly. Netflix, Tumblr, Pintrest, Pandora, Skype, Steam, Sonos, BBC, NPR, Twitch are some that I had no trouble quickly installing and using. The email integration is great, and the goodreads integration is absolutely fantastic.- Most of the settings and features are very intuitive, and when using for the first time there will typically be very basic, quick tutorials.- A great deal for the price.- If you own Amazon content in their cloud its a matter of seconds to access it. And if you have Prime, the kindle is a no-brainer.All in all a great device. However there are a number of limiting factors and mild annoyances that build up to a loss of a star for me. The good news is that many of these can be fixed; the question is whether they might actually be fixed. Here's my problems with the device:- Apps are solely from the Amazon Kindle App store. This is useful in some ways, as you can control apps from your amazon account remotely, but also limiting in others. Compared to the Google Play store the selection is lacking. Although it should be mentioned that this may be partially be design, since there are many apps that do not work (yet) on this kindle's version of android.  Even so, apps can be side-loaded onto the device if you have basic technical know-how. For example, the Humble Bundle App works perfectly on my kindle. To be fair a lot of apps are pretty much crap, but I'd like to have the options for more, albeit mixed with some quality control.- App permissions can sometimes be downright creepy, i.e. a stupid game or simple app having access to data  that it clearly does not need to function and you would rather keep personal. I understand that this is not strictly Amazon's responsibility but rather that of the third-party developers and the owner of the kindle, but its worth mentioning here.- The placement of the only physical buttons, the power and volume buttons, isn't as intuitive as I would like. I find myself accidentally pressing the wrong ones from time to time. I suppose that I might just have to get used to them though.- I would've liked the option for a mircoSD slot, but I guess we live in the age of the ~cloud~. The 16 GB isn't really 16 GB, which is par for the course. But its even less than you might think, you only get 10.6 GB. Unless all your content is on or going to be on your amazon account, spring for the 32 or 64 GB model.- The 7” version only has a camera facing you; no camera facing outwards.  Not really super important unless you want it.- The Carousel is plain stupid. This is a function that works well on other multi-touch devices, but on this kindle it just plain doesn't work well. The intended function is to quickly pick up what you had been doing previously, and for reading books this is still useful. However for everything else it isn't very. In particular if you load up things (like drm-free books via usb) they ALL appear as new on the Carousel, and you can only remove them one at a time. If there was someway to customize it, like so that everything new did not appear and you could lock in which apps you wanted to appear on it, then it might be functional, but as it is I ignore it completely unless I want to get back to the last book I was reading.- Some options for organizing books would be helpful rather than just sort by title/author/recent and displaying covers. An option for alphabetized letter sections would be nice, as well as some indication of a scroll bar to the right hand side.- One of the first things I did in my settings was turn off letting things automatically detect where I am located. I have wi-fi only, and I don't really need it on, plus nearly everything asks for it which just kind of creeps me out. But, and this is the most annoying thing, every single time an app or website requests it I get a pop-up asking me if I want to enable location-based services. Let me repeat this: Every. Single. Time. And a lot of apps will consistently ask. So at least once every 5-20 minutes, depending on what I'm using, I will be interrupted by this pop-up asking me this question even though the answer is pretty much always no. Which I thought was, you know, the point of me disabling it in the settings to begin with. I don't want to have to turn on Quiet Time all the time just to get this to stop.

Reviews.Title: Yes!!!  Amazon finally got it right with this one!
