Reviews.Title: Great Small Tablet; Love It!
Reviews.Author: Music fan
Reviews.Content: I have the original Kindle Fire which I have really enjoyed.  Also have a full-size iPad which is a great size for watching movies in bed, but really too big/heavy to play games.  The original Kindle Fire has only 8 GB storage (partly taken up by software) so I wanted another smaller tablet.  It was between the new Kindle HDX or the new iPad mini.  One thing I didn't like about the iPad mini (besides the price tag) is that the bezzle on the long sides is so narrow, it is hard to hold the device without getting your thumb on the display (which screws up games).  When I saw the HDX on sale on Cyber Monday, I grabbed it.It's fast, thin, light and easy to hold for long periods of time.  I can't believe how light it is compared to my KFire! There are several design changes, such as the ability to show the percentage the battery is charged in the little icon in the top right corner. You have to swipe down from the top of the display to access settings and other utilities.  I got the 32 GB version, so there is plenty of room for games and other apps.  I did download a Prime Instant Video to watch off-line, but I don't like the small display for watching movies.About that display -- I compared the HDX to the original Fire, looking at the same page of a book that has alot of white space on it.  White is a color, and like all colors, it can be "warm" or "cool."  A cool white is "bluish", and a warm white will be a little yellowish.  When I compared the 2 kindle displays for a book, I was shocked to see something I never noticed before.  On the original Fire, the white is "cool/bluish" and there is yellowish tint seeping in around the edges of the pages of the book I was comparing!  This never bothered  me; as I said, I never noticed it.  On the new HDX, the opposite is true --  the color white is warm (yellowish) with the blue/purple (that so many have commented about) seeping in around the edges of the book.  I doubt that this will bother me, and I feel that the people who complained about this and sent back this beautiful little device because of it, need to get a life!  BTW, the page on the HDX doesn't look yellowish to me at all; it is only when compared side-by-side to the original Fire that you can detect the different tints to the white color.I love playing games on the HDX, as even fast running games (such as my favorite Temple Run 2) work without stalling.  And, I got Temple Run Oz (finally) which was not compatible with the original Fire.There are some design features I don't like, such as the way the charger sticks in at an angle.  But charging is very fast using the included charger. My only real issue now is the battery life.  I am currently charging it up, and I am going to see if I can get anything close to 10 hours of "mixed use" on it.  (Yes, there are ways to extend battery life, such as turning off wifi when not using it.  Search on the internet for other tips.)Edit about battery life:  I usually find that when products are advertised as "up to X hours on a single battery charge (depending on settings, usage, blah blah blah)"  I usually get half that. What concerned me about the HDX was that I had fallen asleep with the HDX unplugged, watching a PREVIOUSLY DOWNLOADED movie (a 2.5 hour movie downloaded in "better" quality; after it finished, the display went into sleep mode)-- the next morning, the battery was showing only 35% charged from fully charged the night before.  Since many people posting on the forums with battery problems were told to do a "hard reboot"  I tried that then fully charged the battery again (luckily, charging is pretty quick.)  Downloading music, and letting the display go to sleep mode, the HDX lost only about 10% per hour.  But as soon as I picked it up and played some games for a little while (like Temple Run 2) the battery much more rapidly depleted (this is with wifi turned on, as music was simultaneously downloading).  Then I recharged it, and again tested that same 2.5 hour previously downloaded movie -- with wifi turned off, "airplane mode" turned on, and brightness set at about 70%, the battery drained from fully charged to 65%. So, finally, I downloaded a 2 hour SD quality movie to my HDX, and going from fully charged, with wifi off, and brightness lowered to about 50%, the battery went to 88%, losing only 12%.  Yes, a big improvement over my original KFire which lost double that, 25%, under the same conditions.When I got my HDX it was about 70% charged.  Looking in the settings, I saw that the software was up-to-date.  I was able to download content, read, and play games, without the HDX turning itself off and rebooting (as many have complained of).  The next morning, I saw a notification that there had been a software update -- one thing that was changed is that you can now put apps and books into "collections."  Not only that, but apparently my HDX "synced" wirelessly with my iPad Kindle reading app, where I had already put some books into collections.  Those same books now appear in collections on my HDX without my doing anything. Thank you Amazon.I give this 5 stars, certainly in comparison to the original Kindle Fire.  In general, this HDX is spectacular and the price is great.

Reviews.Title: bargain despite the blue
Reviews.Author: Marcus L. Weiss
Reviews.Content: Must first acknowledge the 'blue thing...'  Yes--blue borders.  I have grown to find them perfectly fine.  It is just a slight blue haze at the borders--when displaying white--of the screen.  I got used to them very quickly and now actually kind of like them when I (rarely) notice them at all.  If you must read with a white background (sepia or black is easier on the eyes in any case) then this might not be the machine for you.  But for everyone else--where you gonna go?  Every single tablet has some issue--the nexus 7 has little power, the big ipad is overpriced, the little one is both overpriced and under-powered, the big hdx is much less capable as it has the same power components but needs to display all that extra space.If you can deal with the 'blue thing' and get around the 'mojito' by well circulated means--this thing is a wonderful bargain.  Sound, power, silly-pretty display, feel...and did I mention power???

Reviews.Title: Is it worth it to upgrade from Kindle Fire to Kindle Fire HDX?
Reviews.Author: RusselCornelson
Reviews.Content: I figured I would make this an ongoing review.DAY ONE - ObservationsPACKAGING: was appropriately sized;  the kindle was well protected and had no noticeable defects/scratches or damage in transit.  The kindle came to me holding a charge so I could instantaneously turn it on and play with it.  Brownie point #1SIZE: It is significantly lighter than my original fire,  and the tapered edges make it feel quite thin.  Not a fan of the tapered edges at this point,  seems slippery like I am going to drop it.  Might just be the way I hold it ..CHARGER:  I am not a fan of the charger port location;  due to the tapered edges ... the mini-USB plug goes in on a weird angle.  Can't just hold the thing flat and push it in ... I can see I will need to be very careful when plugging it in.SCREEN:  Turning on the HDX ... had a instant WOW factor.  The screen is so much better than my original fire it is almost ridiculous to compare the two.  Very crisp, clear picture and ...TOUCH RESPONSE:  I am sure it's due to the power behind it (CPU) that the responsiveness of the touch screen and smooth scrolling are also massive improvements over my original kindle.SETUP:  It took no time at all to setup;  it linked all my old books and apps automatically.  It was seemless .. my old kindle was still warm sitting beside me and I already had this one up and running with all my usual apps on it. Well done AmazonBROWSING SPEED:  One of the most improved aspects I notice is how fast the browsing of the web is.  This is something I used to not use on my original kindle ... If I had to goto a webpage I pulled out the laptop, not anymore .. the HDX is very responsive and fast,  I may argue it's faster than my viao with an i7 processor and 8Gb ram ... well at least when it comes to Browsing the web.FIRST NIGHT READING EXPERIENCE:  I found an auto brightness setting which is awesome;  lights go out, screen dims automatically.I'll update more after I get to play with it more.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HDX
Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer
Reviews.Content: I have this unit for several weeks now and since then I have experienced a couple of slow down response and three "blue screens" although the unit is 40%, 80 % and 55 % charged, the first time it came back after 4 hours, the second and third time after several minutes. I have the older Kindle Fire for quite a while now and did not experience anything like these from the older unit.

Reviews.Title: I Love the HDX Kindle!!!!
Reviews.Author: plopez
Reviews.Content: Love it! It's lighter faster & clearer!  This post has to be thirteen words but this is all I have to say!

Reviews.Title: Great For Reading in Bed!
Reviews.Author: Homer B. Brown Jr.
Reviews.Content: Fast response, beautiful, sharp picture,  great for reading at night without additional lights.  Use it primarily for reading books and very happy with it.

Reviews.Title: 10/10 would buy again
Reviews.Author: Antonio
Reviews.Content: Extremely fast, a joy to hold, long battery life (with careful use), with a decent office suite available. What's not to love?

Reviews.Title: Better than fire.  A caveman might disagree.
Reviews.Author: Christian Burnett
Reviews.Content: Got this for my girlfriend as a birthday present to replace her Kindle Fire HD.  She loves the lighter weight, brighter, clearer screen, and speed.

Reviews.Title: Great small tablet but wish it had a back facing camera
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I love the Kindle Fire HDX 7".  It fits into my purse and does everything I need to do on the fly.  My calendar, contacts for email, books to read and a game to play if I want to.  The only thing lacking is a back facing camera.  I would love to take pictures when the occasion presents itself.  The front facing camera is great for Skype but I don't do that very often.  Maybe in the future Amazon may consider upgrading the Fire HDX with both a front and back facing camera.

Reviews.Title: It was a choice of Nexus 7 vs. Fire HDX ... I made the right choice
Reviews.Author: James C. Westland
Reviews.Content: It was a choice of Nexus 7 vs. Fire HDX ... I bought the Fire and made the right choice.  I've had this for a day now and am impressed by:1.Clarity and richness of the screen.  This is a perfectly good book reader; easy on the eyes2.Speed of processor, network access...it's very noticable (I have a Cisco E2500 router which takes advantage of MIMO and dual band)3.User Interface (users seem to prefer the native Android of the Nexus, but I actually like Kindle's simplicity)4.The Silk Browser does seem to be faster (x2-x3) than browsers on my Mac Air, or 4th Gen iPad5.Amazon's Prime video, etc. content ... I would download these anyway from another tablet, so why not AmazonThe biggest gripe of other reviewers seems to be Amazon's aggressive advertising and link to their ecosystem.  I have the special offers (cheaper) version, and don't really find the ads annoying (if I did $20 would fix that).  And I like the direct link to Amazon's content.  Nor does Amazon try to prevent you from sideloading APKs (they actually give you an installer on the device) nor from rooting (you can relatively easily install CyanogenMod I've heard).  In truth, I think rooting would be a big mistake, as you would lose out on Amazon's ecosystem without gaining anything.  The better route is to sideload the Nova Launcher (or there are several other launchers that do just as well) as they more or less remove any advertising, and give you a more conventional Android interface.  I make sure that I have links on the Nova Launcer dock to Amazon store and to Silk.  It's the best of both worlds.Update...I've had my HDX for two weeks now, and am pleased that Amazon has such a light hand in controlling their UI.  I've loaded the Nova Launcher on my HDX, with docked icons for Kindle Store, and Silk Browser.  The result is a better UI than IOS or Nexus 7.  Almost everything I want is sideloadable.  I tried sideloading GooglePlay (*HaHa*) but that didn't work for a fairly obvious reason -- Amazon did not want to be responsible for an App that collects payments outside their own ecosystem (it opens up a host of headaches for them).I purchased the NETGEAR Push2TV Wireless Display HDMI Adapter - Miracast and WiDi (PTV3000) and after a bit of fiddling (I had to load the latest update to get the HDX to mirror) had it working.  For those who don't know, this essentially provides the sort of display mirroring on a TV that you get with Apple TV and the iPad, but without the content limitations.  It works flawlessly, and I have been using this more than my Roku3 to watch movies, YouTube, etc.  The X-ray feature on Amazon Videos is nice (essentially access to IMDB database while watching a movie) works well, and is actually quite useful.I even used the Mayday button once trying to set up the Netgear Push2TV ... it works as advertised and Amazon staff are great!In my opinion for a variety of reasons which I would classify under the general rubric of Amazon's "ecosystem" the HDX is better than Nexus 7 and iPad Mini-Retina (which is ridiculously overpriced), which makes it the best 7" tablet available.Oh... and be sure to buy the Amazon Kindle Fire HD Standing Polyurethane Origami Case (will only fit All New Kindle Fire HD 7"), Mineral Black ... this is (if you  look at product reviews) an unloved and misunderstood accessory.  I was not impressed when I first got it, but now that I own it, I think it is the best case out there (though too expensive in my opinion).  The stand and magnetic cover work as advertised.  The tray that the Kindle sits in is magnetic and holds the HDX well, but allows it easily to be removed and reinserted.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding with a couple of short comings!!!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Great screen, but needs GPS CHIP.  Needs more recent version of Android.  Very good support. Otherwise competes well with Nexus 7.

Reviews.Title: HDX and Cover Eval
Reviews.Author: Marvin M.
Reviews.Content: Not the fault of the tablet but the cover for it is difficult to keep stable on many surfaces...plain ridge cover like the HD would be a nice. option

Reviews.Title: Excited
Reviews.Author: Amanda Vasquez
Reviews.Content: I'm very happy with the Kindle Fire HDX the picture and sound is amazing it did not disappoint what so ever. It's very easy to navigate around it, so you don't get lost.

Reviews.Title: SO NOT Worth It!!!.....Read Follow Up....
Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer
Reviews.Content: I have only had this new Fire for a couple of hours, and have only had about 20 minutes to 'play' with it and I am already hooked!!  It is SO worth the upgrade to the HDX!  Love how user friendly it is, love the new email system, love the vibrant colors, love the feature that tracks how quick/slow you read and how much time/pages left to the end of a chapter.  This is just the beginning!  I can't imagine how much greater it probably is!  I can't wait to get the time to play with it more!  Thank you Amazon for another GREAT Kindle!A follow up!!!  Since my original review, I've had to return not only the original, but TWO more!!!  The first two would not hold a charge when in sleep mode.  The third one was charging for NINE hours and only made it up to 58% charged!  To make matters worse it came with no original box, which worried me as to if it was refurbished.  Amazon admitted it was a mistake and I was sent refurbished.  This has been a HUGE frustration dealing with having to call each time, packing them up and then making the 25-30 minute drive one way to our local UPS store!  I have no doubt I will love this device if I ever get one that works the way it is supposed to work!To date I have yet to receive an HDX that will hold a charge.  I am now on the 5th unit.  I cannot keep the internet on or will will drain within a few hours to dead.  In fact just downloading my latest books will drain at least 25% of my power that I had before turning on the internet to download the books.  Out of frustration I have kept this 5th one and just don't turn the internet on.  Now after just a month of using it, the screen keeps flashing like it is going to die/go blank.  This is the WORST problem I've ever had with any electronic device I've had!  Although Amazon is fine with sending replacements over and over there has been no compensation for my aggravation and the 1 hour drive to get it to the nearest USPS store to drop off the duds!VERY unhappy with Amazon at this point and I have lost a lot of faith in their customer service!

Reviews.Title: I love it!
Reviews.Author: Gloria E Shank
Reviews.Content: Love it!  Haven't had much time to apprciate it but love that I can check what email needs attention and light enough to carry w/me where ever I go.  I know that there's more but to busy w/holidays to take advantage.

Reviews.Title: Mayday very helpful, great sound and screen.
Reviews.Author: 12 Paw Ranch
Reviews.Content: I upgraded to this from a Kindle Fire 7" that I bought about a year ago.  The reason I upgraded was to be able to download Prime videos.  The last thing I thought I would use was the Mayday button - I usually am the person that other people come to with electronics questions.  To my surprise, the Mayday button was helpful even for me.  There was a problem with me having too many Kindle devices registered, so my books would not open on the new device.  Even though I could have fixed that myself, contacting Mayday got the job done faster.  I talked with two Mayday operators since buying this new Kindle - both were easy to understand and knowledgeable.The sound and HD screen is very impressive, a big improvement over my Fire from 2012.  The processor is also impressively fast.  I have to say that battery life is not great, but adequate.  I have yet to try using the device with the WiFi off, which likely would improve battery life.  I don't find the special offers to be intrusive - they are only on the unlock screen, and are kind of like a screen saver.  There actually have been times when I have looked into the offers, so for me the extra cost to remove the offers would not be worth it.

Reviews.Title: amazed again
Reviews.Author: ls
Reviews.Content: My first Kindle Fire (1st gen) amazed me two years ago.  I didn't think my new Kindle Fire HDX would be as amazing but I was wrong.  The color is brilliant and the improvements are everything I could imagine.  I was worried that it would be difficult to transfer all my contents to the new one but I was up and running within minutes and everything was transferred with no problem.  I love my new Kindle Fire HDX.  I will be gifting my old Kindle Fire to my 9 year old granddaughter for Christmas and she will be thrilled.  So, in conclusion I could not be happier with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: amazing
Reviews.Author: duchess62146
Reviews.Content: As a longtime Kindle user it was time to upgrade again. From my first Kindle with the sd card to the HDX, I have never been disappointed. I am 67 years young and am constantly amazed at the advances in technology. Keep up the good work.

Reviews.Title: Great graphics & picture quality in a small package !
Reviews.Author: lparsh
Reviews.Content: Great graphics & picture quality, both pictures & videos are really great!  The only negative is in the battery drain.  It's not really a problem, but I was expecting the time to recharge to be more than 7-8 hours during high use.  Otherwise I would highly recommend the Kindle Fire HDX model. Happy with the speed & storage space as well (I have the 32 GB model).

Reviews.Title: Outstanding picture quality at a very reasonable price
Reviews.Author: Mats
Reviews.Content: Absolutely perfect for video. We mostly watch HBOGO and Netflix, great picture quality at a very reasonable price. Haven't had a reason to try Mayday yet.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HDX 7" 32 GB
Reviews.Author: susan k. meeker
Reviews.Content: Love it. It does everything I expected and more. Very happy with the addition of Mayday. People are great to talk with and are always there to help no matter the question.

Reviews.Title: Great Screen Detail
Reviews.Author: D.J.B. "water man"
Reviews.Content: A pleasant improvement from the 7" Kindle HD that I sold to my brother. This 7" HDX model has a more detailed screen that makes the smaller sized screen more useful for web searches and emails.

Reviews.Title: I CAN GET TO THINGS WITHIN 1SEC
Reviews.Author: Julie
Reviews.Content: Best thing ever bigger than the iPod smaller than the iPad perfect size for my hands I can get to things within 1 sec

Reviews.Title: New Kindle Fire HDX
Reviews.Author: coulter
Reviews.Content: I have the original Kindle fire which I love but this one ....wow!!!!!  It powers up fast and I like that it will go to sleep but wakes up fast.  It move from screen to screen with the greatest of ease.  It is not hard to get around.  I just love it more!!!!!!  Sorry original kindle, but remember you were my first.  :)

Reviews.Title: my new favorite toy
Reviews.Author: AMBERISAAC55
Reviews.Content: It's wonderful haven't had any problems at all. Packaging was wonderful, was very nice and just opening my new toy was so exciteing like being a child on Christmas. I love it so much great quality but my only wish is that I wish it had the camera on the back but that's the only thing I don't like

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT
Reviews.Author: Jeannette
Reviews.Content: I love my Kindle Fire HDX. I can't really complain about it. It's a great tablet for the price you pay.

Reviews.Title: I love my Kindle Fire!
Reviews.Author: Sami B
Reviews.Content: I love my Kindle and I use it every day. I love cloud for all of my pictures. I love to be able to go from facebook or pinterest to reading my books, to playing games all in one sitting. Best toy I have. ;-)

Reviews.Title: great !!!
Reviews.Author: MIGUEL ANGEL CALLAN
Reviews.Content: Simply greatMy first kindle and I have had no problems. I recommend it strongly. No regrets at all pals

Reviews.Title: E$asy to set-up
Reviews.Author: S. TANNENBAUM
Reviews.Content: Easy to set-up and use for a novice.  Tried Android based unit & after 5 hours gave up.  This I had set-up & running within 15 minutes.

Reviews.Title: Hard to beat the price to feature ratio with this Kindle Fire HDX
Reviews.Author: KAYCEE
Reviews.Content: From its design to display to speed and functionality, Kindle Fire HDX is a very good tablet. Crystal clear HD display with the fastest processor in a tablet make it an attractive buy. A rear camera would have been superb along with a robust app library like the Google Play store. Also support for Google apps would't hurt. Great HD experience with Amazon Prime and Netflix. VUDU and other video apps need "sideloading" at the moment. Reading experience is amazing. Makes up for a great holiday gift this year.

Reviews.Title: Perfect travel companion
Reviews.Author: Jeff Fraley
Reviews.Content: I travel frequently and my wife got this for me before my last long trip.  Excellent choice for reading books and watching HD movies.

Reviews.Title: Love this Kindle
Reviews.Author: Inga
Reviews.Content: It took me a long time to make the decision to buy a Kindle and now I am so happy that I did.  I can buy books and have them immediately and can easily take my "books" with me to read anywhere.  The lighted screen is wonderful as is the size. I looked at the Kindle Fire but this model is so much more user friendly.

Reviews.Title: kindle
Reviews.Author: Zach Braniger
Reviews.Content: I love the kindle fire hdx it has a great speakers and display is awesome I hpoe other rate 5

Reviews.Title: Glad I had to wait to buy a Kindle
Reviews.Author: C. Aronson
Reviews.Content: I was going to buy a Kindle a few years back, but instead, due to finances, went with an inexpensive tablet. I am now the proud and happy owner of the Kindle Fire HDX 7" 32 GB and loving it! I love the speed with which the pages load, and the clarity of the pages is unreal! I love reading and the pages are so easy to see in any light...regular room light, dark room, and outside. Playing games that I had previously played on my old tablet is a whole new experience. The games are more vibrant, and no hesitation.I haven't used the Kindle for music yet, but based on what other have said, I am sure it will be great.I do like that they are now including the rapid charger with the Kindle, rather than having to purchase one separately. I have not had the need to use the "Mayday" button yet, but it is nice to know that it is there when I need it.I have not had this Kindle too long, but I can't find anything I don't like. Should that change, I will update this review. I also want to add that I am a Senior Citizen and want to let other Seniors know that they should not be afraid to buy a Kindle...it is so easy to set up (open box, register) and use!While I was having regrets about not buying a Kindle the first time, I am glad I had to wait because I now have one that has been improved and that I expect to have for some time.

Reviews.Title: The new Fire HDX 32 GB is AWESOME
Reviews.Author: Sara Rice
Reviews.Content: Another great Amazon Kindle Fire. Super easy to set it up.  Open the box and turn it on.  Register it and you are good to go!I purchased this as a gift and my daughter loves her new Fire HDX.  It is smaller and lighter than her previous Fire and wow it does a great job.  My daughter uses it to listen to music and read books.  It also has a great browser so it's super fast for her to search the web.  I really like how she can also watch her favorite shows and movies and with Prime it's so worth it.There are plenty of Apps and I am really impressed how fast it is.  I would consider it as a really nice tablet and for the price, you really can't beat it.

Reviews.Title: A great tablet
Reviews.Author: Sally in Colorado
Reviews.Content: This kindle fire tablet is finally really a tablet.  I love it for reading, doing email and running apps.  I am an app developer and I am have written an app for iPad, and android. So I have tried them all.  I own Samsung Tab 3, Nexus 7, 2 iPads and a kindle (1st gen). So I am very familiar with all these tablets.  I would have given it 5 stars, but the apps on iPad are better and more of them. It could also use a back camera to be competitive but I never use that anyway.  For the price, Amazon has done an excellent job on this device.  I even used the "May day" service a few times when I got it.Later:  I am finding the battery usage frustrating.  The battery doesn't last as long as my laptop.  It runs done faster than any other tablet that I own (iPad, Samsung Tab 3, Nexus 7). So I am down grading my rating.

Reviews.Title: Excellent!!
Reviews.Author: Diane
Reviews.Content: First tablet ever and I LOVE IT!! Has everything I need and more!So glad I purchased it and the price was the best! I've waited for this and couldn't be happier!

Reviews.Title: Enids review
Reviews.Author: catwalk
Reviews.Content: I find the quality of pic excellent. I love the video link to movies and television shows. I just wish there were more television shows available. The Kindle Fire HDX is easy to use. The streaming is fast.

Reviews.Title: My Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: Dorothy Facklam
Reviews.Content: I love my Kindle Fire HDX. I am still learning a lot about it and how to use it. I never had a tablet before and this is nice because it is the right size to take any place with you.

Reviews.Title: Kindle hdx is easy on the eyes
Reviews.Author: J Pearson
Reviews.Content: What an awesome product.  I really enjoyed using it, but decided I preferred a regular camera & purchased the 8.9.  I returned this product. The camera on the 7" is fine for Skype, but it is very disconcerting to use it for anything else.  I previously had the ipad2.  The fire hdx turns on & starts up rather slowly.  But the quality of picture and ease in reading books creates a wondrous experience.

Reviews.Title: Great tablet
Reviews.Author: Laura Schering
Reviews.Content: Love this tablet. Has met all my ends plus. Easy to use. Very sensitive to the touch. Graphic s are clear, bright and excellent.

Reviews.Title: Completely Self-Indulgent Purchase - Absolutely Delightful
Reviews.Author: Byzantine Dixie
Reviews.Content: I have been straddling the Apple / Android fence for a while now, with one foot in both camps.  But the time came to declare allegiance.  Music and video purchases are less and less dependent on hard media like CDs and DVDs and are becoming more and more cloud based.  Which cloud…that was the decision to make.So Amazon came out with fireTV…and I took the plunge and decide to go with Amazon for my video purchases.  I have been a prime member since its inception…and it is the first place I go to when I am looking to buy something.  I love Amazon…probably in an unwholesome way.With that decision behind me I was now free to find a device to take entertainment with me when I travel for work.  Do you have any idea how long and painful it can be to copy DVDs into digital files to take along when traveling…I simply did not have the patience to convert all 14 seasons Dallas!  I needed a device that would hold a number of videos to get me through at least 2 weeks overseas at a time.  Reliable streaming overseas is generally not an option for a variety of reasons.And so I bought a Kindle FireHDX (64MB, no ads) and have been absolutely delighted…I seriously couldn’t be happier.  It is so FAST…compared to my android ASUS transformer tablet.  The video quality is beautiful.  The sound is great and it is extremely simple to download videos…even Prime videos…to take along on my travels.Of course, nothing is perfect.  There are some disappointments but they are relatively minor.1) Battery life is disappointing if wifi is not disabled.  That has been my experience.  I will lose 15 – 20% overnight if I leave the wifi on.  With the wifi off…battery life is very good.  If there is an option to turn off wifi after being asleep for a while…I don’t know about it yet.  Long term, hopefully something like this will be developed in a software update.2) Lack of a mini HDMI out.  I like to plug my device into the HDMI ports of hotel TVs and watch my shows from the bigger screen.  When I realized too late that it had no HDMI out, I bought a Tronsmart miracast device.  It will work but not as smoothly or easily as a simple cable would.  I think the miracast is not quite ready for prime time yet.  It is not the end of the world if I can’t hook up the hotel TV.  Watching directly from the Kindle works well.3) Apps…need more.  I once had a Blackberry Playbook.  What awesome tablet that was…really.  Fine quality device, perfect in every way…except for the limited number of apps.  Amazon has to make this a priority.  And the apps need to work beautifully…like they do on my iPhone (see, I said I had one foot in both camps!)4) Flicker.  I notice a disturbing flicker with one of my apps.  Haven’t let determined if this is strictly a single app issue or if it will show up elsewhere.  I’ll update later if it is more than just this one app.All in all I feel this was a most self-indulgent purchase…it is such a sweet device and the perfect travel companion.  (Don’t tell my husband!)

Reviews.Title: kindle fire 7 Quit working
Reviews.Author: Roy Cooper
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my wife and have had it maybe month and everything stopped working can not even unlock screen when you reset it.

Reviews.Title: Easy To Use
Reviews.Author: Big Momma
Reviews.Content: Loved it! It took a minute but I caught on to it. Smooth operation of software and other functions. The input buttons are on an angle and it's a bit different plugging cords in. I'm used to a home or wake up button. I don't like to take my kindle fire HDX 7 outside the protective case just to get it going again. I wonder if the power button is gonna eventually wear out.

Reviews.Title: Happier Than a Child at Christmas!
Reviews.Author: Moosie
Reviews.Content: Oh My God!  I LOVE this Kindle.  This replaced my old Kindle Keyboard.  I didn't realize I was living in the dinosaur age with that until I bought this new one.  I wanted to treat myself to an early birthday present.  Amazon really pulled out all the stops with this one!  I'm so proud of this Kindle.It does just about everything a computer can do.  The colors, graphics are awesome!  Games on this Kindle HDX device are so vivid, clear and work flawlessly.  I love having access to my music, the downloads are faster and easier.  I downloaded a classical music radio app, and I am so pleased with this app.  I also love reading my books on it, the screen is easier to see, looks better.I am so happy with this purchase.  This thing is so precious to me.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Khnet
Reviews.Content: Fantastic tablet, great for kids too. I love the kindle free time features and limits you can set. Easy access and fun to play with

Reviews.Title: It's good but not great
Reviews.Author: bluewolf37
Reviews.Content: I have owned several different tablets and didn't wow me like i was hoping it was going to.Pros* The speakers are wonderful compared to all of my old tablets and some old laptops.* The touchscreen is the most responsive touchsreen that i have ever used. (i didn't realize my old tablet had lag until i used this)* it's fast all around from loading apps to starting a movie* The screen is beautiful when watching movies.* it feels very solid in the hands like it is built well.* If you have amazon prime you have access to the kindle lending library and amazon prime videos (this was the reason i decided on kindle this time)*the app store has comixology* It has a feature called Quiet time so you don't get notifications wanking you up when you are asleep* Wireless reception is very strong and stable.* Amazon music store is normally cheaper and better than itunes and the play store. (I love the fact that i don't have to download my music to every device i own to listen to it)* it is a good price.* Some movies and books have a wonderful feature called X-Ray that gives you useful information. In movies it can tell you the actors and actresses on screen and what song is playing. If you click in the names out connects to imdb for more info.Cons*you cannot connect to the play store and the amazon app store is extremely lacking and/or outdated. You can sideload some apps but any that connect to google services wont work 100%. For example I sideloaded chrome and even though I can use it to browse i cant sign in to sync bookmarks with my computer and phone. I also got the youtube app and it worked but once again you cant sign in to see all your subscriptions. Gmail is compleatly useless...Etc...*There is a blue haze around the edges of the screen that is almost painful when reading. I ended up changing kindle reading settings to a night mode so it didn't bother me.*apps that had no problems on other tablets or phones seem less stable on the kindle. I bought a game on the amazon app store and it ended up blue screening the device which was surprising since i never had a tablet give me the blue screen of death before (but to be fair it hasn't had a problem since then )* battery life when watching videos is worse than my asus tablet* you don't see the date when you pull down the notification barLast thoughts*It is probably a good idea to add a password to the kindle because it is always signed into amazon. This includes their kindle books store, app store, music store, and physical product store. So if you have kids or fear it may get stolen a password is a good idea. I would also look into the parental controls.

Reviews.Title: Unreliable and Unimpressive
Reviews.Author: JVR Mom
Reviews.Content: This was the 4th Kindle Fire we recieved.  #1 wouldnt connect to WiFi #2 Battery dead less than 90 mins #3 dead battery AND WIFI issues... i continues to give them a try becuase the Kindle Free time seemed like a good value for my 3 yr old.Unimpressed by Kindle Free time content.  Id prefer to spend a few bucks each month and own the content of my choice.  We will purchase another MS Surface Table and a kid friendly case.

Reviews.Title: What a heartbreak! You Can't Use GOOGLE!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I bought my very first tablet, the Kindle Fire. I was so excited when it arrived. I put on the screen protector, put it in it's case, set it up with my acct information. I was in awe of the look and feel of it. It is beautiful! The picture and sound are amazing too. If you love Amazon, this is probably exactly what you want!I went into the situation blind. I read a lot of kindle books so I thought the Fire would be great. I didn't understand that a tablet would block you from using specific programs they deem competition. I use Google Music, I pay for unlimited music each month. It never occurred to me that I wouldn't be able to stream my music over my tablet! It doesn't make any sense to me! My HTC phone, which uses google, lets me download Amazon apps so why wouldn't Amazon let me use Google?!I went into chat with an Amazon rep to find out if there was anything I could do to get my music on it. They said no, they were sorry. They said I was free to buy music from them tho. Of course I am but I don't want to buy every stupid song that pops into my head. I'd go broke!And they don't offer anything like unlimited streaming that I could switch to.In looking through the kindle apps, I also learned that the Google apps that are offered (maps, gmail) had horrible ratings with comments that they don't work at all.I am a HUGE Amazon fan. And even through this, I am a loyal customer. But I am  so deeply disappointed. I am disappointed that they have chosen an isolationist approach to their product. Having my music available to me would not have taken any dollars away from them. I still would have bought my books and movies through them. Probably a lot more than I do now. I don't buy my music thru Amazon, I buy it thru iTunes. I always have and I always will. I keep my music on Google Music. I use the unlimited music to hear new songs so I know if I want to buy it or not. By not letting me stream music they've lost book and movie purchases. They never would have had much music business from me. Maybe some, bec I might be too lazy to use iTunes. The thing is, I have my way of doing things. I use many products. I don't want to feel contained or limited or be forced into changing for literally a BAD BUSINESS decision by Amazon.I wanted the kindle bec I thought it might be nice to use in the kitchen or around the house specifically for entertainment purposes. Reading, music, movies, tv shows. A sort of all purpose entertainment center. Like they advertise. What they don't say on their product page is that you won't be able to use Google services. It should be very specific for people like me who are new to the tablet world. I bought a case and protective covers and the warranty.  Amazon is charging me money for the returns and some of it can't be returned. I feel like they withheld important information and now I am paying the price for it.I did some research last night and decided to go with the second generation Nexus. It will stream music, allow Amazon apps and it has a cute keyboard.  They don't force me into using them exclusively!Amazon is really on the wrong side of this!!

Reviews.Title: So disappointed
Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer
Reviews.Content: I spent months reviewing and comparing tablets, and as an avid Amazon-user I thought I had made a well informed choice. Wrong. This tablet honestly stinks. The technology seems half-baked. Some of the programs work flawlessly while others are glitchy and frustrating. For example, I can't even access the app store but the silk internet browser works fine! The app store half loads, and none of the links even work. It's definitely not my internet connection, because all of my other devices are running flawlessly. I read a bunch of blogs and tried doing a few things (resetting time/date settings, restarting the kindle, checking internet settings...) I am just so disappointed. As a Mac user, I probably should have shelled out the extra cash and went with the iPad. I am returning this tablet after only one day. Even worse, the Mayday button won't connect me to customer service! It just loads for a while and then reports an error in connection. A rare miss for my Amazon experience.

Reviews.Title: OK, one star says I hate it, not the device, but the experience.
Reviews.Author: FromUtah
Reviews.Content: This device is a handy little device, good graphics, amazingly large sound.  Runs fast, apps that come with it work fine.But...If you want access to all of the open source a freely available software from Google, don't buy this!!!  It is not available, nor will it ever be.  That mean no Google Play, Google Maps, Google Navigation, Google Search, Google Chrome, Google Docs, Google Translate... You get the picture.  Why would anyone want to limit themselves to the offerings at the amazon App Store with such a great little tablet?  Kindle Fire HDX is just a version of Android with an Amazon makeover.  Every aspect of this experience of using this device seems to be geared toward getting you to spend money at Amazon.  Right off the bat you are given a free month of Amazon Prime, the service that costs $79 per year.  They offer streaming videos, but, everything here is on Netflix.  Netflix has more.  Most TV series let you view the first episode for free, but all others cost money.Did I mention, the startup screen is a full-page add for some random irrelevant gadget on Amazon?  And, The top of the screen on the launcher page is, you guessed it, another link bar to Amazon Store Categories for you to accidently click when you want to slide down the top bar to check what messages have been displayed.Now, let's talk google.  Google invented the droid operating system and the google play store has everything under the sun for Android.  Apps like Google Chrome, Gmail, Google Maps, Navigation, Google Drive.  These are not available on the Amazon store.  They really make up the backbone of productivity on the Android system.  Amazon seems to only want you to use this for entertainment, on a pay-as-you-go basis.I'll be looking for a way to load generic Android, or selling this on eBay.Amazon, if you read these, please come out with a more open update for this device's operating system.  I feel like a sucker for getting this.Mine is for sale.

Reviews.Title: Great little tablet!
Reviews.Author: Mom of 3 stinky boys! "Lindsay V."
Reviews.Content: This is a fun little tablet. There are a few pros and a few cons to it though.Pros:I like the smaller size. We also have a 10 inch tablet and this one is much easier to carry around with me.I LOVE the Free Time app for Kids. I love knowing that I can hand my tablet over to my 3 year old and he'll only be able to see and play what I approve for him. I also like that I don't have to tell him when time's up. He just hands me back the tablet and goes to play.Reading on this Kindle is so nice. I love that it holds my spot and tells me how far along I am in the book. I also like that I have access to all the books I've bought in one place. It's a lot easier to carry this around than it is to carry around a heavy book.Cons:I'm not so fond of where the power button is. It's kind of awkward to find. As well as the charging port. It's at an odd angle and I have to actually pay attention to what I'm doing when I plug it in.The apps from the Kindle store are few and far between. There aren't a whole lot of them. There are the basic ones for social networking and a few good (free) games. But I'm hoping that in the near future Amazon will come out with a lot more apps.I also wish I could add more storage space to this like the android tablets. However it's not a HUGE deal because you get storage on your cloud. Which is really nice.Overall I think this is a fun little tablet. I wish I had gotten the one without the special offers as those can get annoying but oh well. I enjoy using this tablet and so do my kids. It does pretty much everything I need a tablet to do!

Reviews.Title: Amazon hit this one out of the park.!
Reviews.Author: Joyce Scott Blessed by the best. "So Blessed."
Reviews.Content: I love this  thing! It can do all the things I like to do . The storage space through Amazon  cloud was a huge selling point.  The 7 inch screen size is ample room for me to look at things without strain. I am also very happy with the "May Day“ button and the representatives that I have talked to. A+++.  I would recommend this Kindle  to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Haven't put it down since I got it!
Reviews.Author: Christopher White
Reviews.Content: Absolutely love this tablet. If you are a prime user and into Amazon books and movies this is the tablet for you. A lot of people mentioned a blue light around the edges of the page when reading, I simply changed the background to the black with white lettering and this eliminates this and also makes it easier to read especially with no light at night.

Reviews.Title: Worth every penny
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love this tablet! So easy to use, has lots of features, and the price is right. I highly recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: love it!
Reviews.Author: mon lucas
Reviews.Content: Love it !  I was waiting for the iPad Mini retina display however decide to get the Kindle fire HDX instead. Love it is better than expected. Love the May day help. The display is sharp and is very fast . if you use for Facebook, emails and shopping there is no better way to Go.  Still testing battery life .  Just wondering if I should had bought the bigger 8.9 kindle HDX. If you are member of Amazon prime don't wait . Get it now.

Reviews.Title: Good for reading, not for collections
Reviews.Author: Beate73
Reviews.Content: I've now had the new Fire HDX for a couple days, and being a now long time iPad user, it's a good alternate to iPad. There aren't as many apps for the Fire as you have for iPad, but I'm guessing that's just a matter of time before they fix that.I mainly bought the Fire so that I could add my very extensive book collection to it. For reading I've been using the Kindle Touch 3GB, and I have more books than I have space. I found it tedious having to add and delete books all the time. I thought the Fire would be a good step up.If you have a couple hundred books, the Fire is perfect for your book collection. But if you're like me, and have been using Kindle for years and have a 6K+ collection, you might be disappointed.First, you have to click on every single book to import it onto the Fire. There is no batching. I really wish they could have had an "add whole collection" option. Importing is tedious at best.Second, you can't just import your old collections and believe that all books will automatically place themselves in the correct collection. First of all, I now have collections from my very first Kindle on the Fire. A Kindle that has been deregistered from my account for ever.The collections that did import correctly, are a mess. Books are missing, or the wrong books are in the wrong collection.Then there is the books that aren't in a collection. If you're viewing your books as collections, you can't find the books that aren't in a collection. It is simply impossible to figure out which book is in a collection and which book needs to go in a collection. I like to organize my books, and collections were the perfect way to do so. On the Touch, that is. On the Fire, it's all a big pile'o'crap, and I can't figure out what's up and what's down.So far, bookwise, Fire has been a huge letdown for me. I was really excited about getting the new HDX with the 64GB hard drive, thinking I'd finally be able to put by books in order. Not so much.As far as reading experience, the Fire is very good. The screen is clear, the text easy to read, and it doesn't hurt your eyes like the iPad does. Which is the only reason I give the Fire HDX 3/5 stars. I really hope Amazon updates the OS real soon where you have the option to import your whole collection with just a few clicks. And most of all I hope they fix the collections issues. Just thinking about what a mess my Kindle is makes me want to cry.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire Is Growing Up!
Reviews.Author: JPP Smorenburg
Reviews.Content: I want to share my feelings about my new HDX 7 which I received recently. I'll update the review as I get to know the HDX as time passes. I use the HDX daily for 2 hours on average reading and surfing. I use a PaperWhite 3G at work and at home and have used previous E-ink Kindle generations for daily reading in the past. Kindle Fire is growing up fast. The vastly upgraded device response and fluidity are already well commented on. The extra speed when surfing the web and navigating the HDX are again a big step up, good work. There is very little display reflection, improving reading once again this gen. Text is totally, faultlessly sharp.A very cool software feature in the Kindle app are the extra Wikipedia and Translation boxes that come together with the dictionary definition box, totally cool. Silk works better, taking many opened tabs in its stride and making the most of the display size with the cool article mode and nicely working full screen option that takes away the tabs and adress bar to move the page upward. I always found the iPad 4:3 display ratio appealing, but the Silk features mentioned above make the 16:9 ratio enjoyable for web surfing while keeping the device as small as possible.The form factor is again much improved with the HDX generation, no apologies necessary anymore. It's much more manageable than my previous generation HD 7; noticably less circumference and a third less weight. The physical buttons are very tactical, unlike those on the previous gen., and the sometimes mentioned "angled" USB port feels and looks solid, not at all awkward. The bezels are smaller and the plastic outer enveloping rim much more so giving a very tight, high quality appearance compared to the previous gen.In my opinion, Amazon have at this generation arrived at a wonderful compromise between "boutique" (like iPad) and "utility" (previous gen. HD) moving steadily toward the iPad. Also with the HDX, there is a better compromise between Amazon presence (say, like an Amazon website-type environment) and an open Android presence (like any generic android tablet) with the HDX showing beautiful, eerily sharp lockscreen wallpapers, app icons matrix and book covers, with removable recommendations which, removed, leave an "Android or iPad like" home screen save for the background, which is (in my opinion) nicely dark with classy icon shadowing.Battery life is at least as enduring as on my previous gen. HD. Sound is as good to my ears.UPDATE:I have some clouding, showing a brighter spot of about an inch in the centre of the display, which is visible on an even background like when reading. I can only get rid of it when switching to white text on black. The slight blue border bleeding is also present, but doesn't bother me at all.UPDATE 12/3/2013: I've requested and was right away permitted after a short live chat an exchange HDX to arrive in a couple of days, amazing stuff!UPDATE 12/5/2013: I received my replacement HDX today. What a miracle of logistics; from across the Atlantic traceable almost to the hour. Even my return HDX I can track. Boggles the mind. Well, I must say the clouding is less with the new one, but I can still see it. My daughter (painter artist) shakes her head and says: "You exchanged it for that?", when I show her the "faulty" one. Must be me then. I'll accept it as a HDX character trait.UPDATE 12/14/2013:The HDX performs excellently, the smaller size and mass, and the very sharp, defined characters are more appreciated as time in use passes. The new ability to sort cloud content in collections is much appreciated. Silk occasionally froze. Disabling page load acceleration solves that.This device is a big improvement over the previous HD; better ergonomics again, better display, less glass glare, much more zip, diminishing the E-reading gap with the glorious PaperWhite. My PW is certainly used less for reading since the HDX is here. As we live in the real world, I think the price:quality ratio is very important, and the HDX has made that ratio more favourable again for my ends, which are: reading E-books, internet news and watching news videos with the best possible display quality and low weight and size at a good price. Weighing the above factors, the HDX-Amazon combo is unbeatable. What I would call a Serious Tablet.Job very well done,Recommended!UPDATE 1/5/2014:For an Epub reader app, I can recommend Aldiko, downloaded through their website via a sent link for the free, non-ad reader. Really hassle-free, with only the basic options for good reading, not playing. The only caveat is crashing of the app with large .Pdf's. But it's not really needed for those; the embedded Kindle Reader app is superior for handling .Pdf. No need to waste space installing the Adobe Reader.For a good enough productivity app, I can recommend the King Soft Free version through the Amazon App Store. No ads, no hassle, easy connection to Google Drive.Good File Manager app: Free no-ad ES File Manager through the Amazon app store. (You can get easy access to your Cloud Account by adding in ES through documents/network/add (+ key at bottom, pick your account)Good Task Manager: Free no-ad ES Task Manager through the Amazon app store.

Reviews.Title: HDX is even better!
Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer "Chuvasia"
Reviews.Content: Being able to download Prime instant videos is sweet!  My son also uses the immersion reading which is a huge step up from a regular audio book.

Reviews.Title: Love, Love, Love it!!!
Reviews.Author: stephanie
Reviews.Content: Absolutely love this Kindle. I have never had one before but my friends do.  I love all the things it can do. Great product.

Reviews.Title: We like them!
Reviews.Author: donald liebes
Reviews.Content: The Kindle Fires I bought are Christmas presents to my wife and myself.  We like them very much and are learning to use them.  We are in our early 70's so it's a challenge.  :)

Reviews.Title: This is the tablet/ereader to get!
Reviews.Author: Chad Homme
Reviews.Content: My wife has had a Kindle for a while and I decided to get one.  This is nothing short of incredible.  Screen clarity is amazing, battery life is great.  Couldn't ask for a better reader/tablet.

Reviews.Title: It just gets better and better!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I've had every single Kindle Fire, but this new HDX is, hands down, one of the most innovative tablets ever. The two best features are the Mayday button and the song lyrics. No tablet that I'm aware of has any support even close to the Mayday button. You simply tap the onscreen button and, voila, a person comes on your screen and helps you. A real person you can see. The can't see you, but they can see your screen. I've used it a couple of times and never waited more than 10-15 seconds before they were right there speaking to me. AMAZING!Second, the new rolling lyrics with your music is awesome, however,  not many songs have the lyrics yet. I'm sure they're working on the data base, but the more current songs are available. On some albums some songs are done but not all. Great idea and hopefully Amazon is bringing lyrics in quickly.And let's not forget xray for movies. Tap the screen and you'll get a pop-up with movie info like the names of which actors are on the screen at any given moment. Awesome!Awesome machine... If it just had front AND rear facing cameras it would be perfect. It does have front facing, but not rear. Try it you'll love it! I hope the Mayday button catches on across the industry because support is usually so difficult! Way to go Amazon!

Reviews.Title: Really good buy!
Reviews.Author: Marwan
Reviews.Content: I wanted a 7" tablet, but I was not sure if I buy the Nexus 7 or the Kindle fire HDX. Eventually I went and bought this device and I am really happy and satisfied. It can do pretty much everything you need!! You can download missing apps from outside sources, so it is not a big deal. Its performance really great and I have never been disappointed so far, the only problem I noticed that this device missing a navigation apps and Google maps doesn't work as expected on it! Beside this issue, the Kindle fire HDX is flawless!

Reviews.Title: Simply AWESOME display. Super THIN. WOW!!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: William Mutschler "Copper Moose"
Reviews.Content: I debated heavily over this, putting it on my one and only thing for Christmas. I wanted to see the performance and size of this, including thin-ness. The color and clarity are simply stunningly fantastic -- better than any other tablet that I've seen. The FAA discount day enabled me to get it at 15% off, enabling me to afford the 64 GB  (my other spec wish-feature), even though I had to use my debit card because…….the day before. I had bought a reconditioned 8.9" Kindle HD, with 32 gb the day before with Amazon Card, but haven't opened it, knowing that this would be here a day later.My kids have filled their Kindles with game crap, but I wanted the extra space to have more books downloaded at the same time, and more space for movies, music and 'future expansion space.'One might laugh, but as a comics fan I read the volume collections. A little small for my old eyes, so I'm sort of forced to use panel view. But, for USA Today, the smallest text size was just perfect. That is an auto format site, and works great.Finally, my OWN Kindle. I had been sharing one used by my son, but now, no more swapping. No drained battery for dear old dad.I don't see a speed difference yet (I'm not a gamer), but this thing is THIN. I'm hoping to get longer battery life with a smaller screen.The only thing so far is that I am adjusting to a smaller Kindle, having been using the 8.9 HD.

Reviews.Title: That Upgrade
Reviews.Author: Z. McMenemy
Reviews.Content: I love it. I went for the slow dumb first gen Kindle to this power house it is amazing love it

Reviews.Title: I would buy another one!
Reviews.Author: Jamie
Reviews.Content: I absolutely LOVE my new Kindle. I have wanted one for about a year so when I heard this new one came out, I definitely wanted one. The resolution is awesome, everything is very quick, I've even resorted to just watching Netflix with the Kindle instead of my TV. The apps/books download very quick and the battery life is awesome on it. The only gripe I will say I have is the fact that you can't change the opening background of it. The picture doesn't bother me but it would of been nice to be able to use my own picture instead of the one they gave. I can't wait to take this to the beach and be able to read my books and not worry! I would recommend this to anybody!

Reviews.Title: A great product!  A definite must have.
Reviews.Author: Cano85
Reviews.Content: Love it!  Does just what I want it to do.  Sharp pics and fast.  A definite recommend.I've been waiting for over a year to purchase one and then the new HDX came out so I'm glad I waited.

Reviews.Title: Worth the upgrade
Reviews.Author: Darren A. Wallace "babysealclubber"
Reviews.Content: My wife loves it. I also have a kindle fire HD, and when I compared watching HD movies side by side there was a visible difference between the HDX and HD. The added 64 GB HD is awesome, my wife can now keep pictures, and she uses it for a lot of things. All in all, I really like the kindle, it's not too big, and not too expensive.

Reviews.Title: Apple, you better watch out.....The Kindle Fire is checking it twice!!
Reviews.Author: Brian Jones
Reviews.Content: I am a Apple fan from the ipod, to ipad, Iphone to Macbook Pro.  I have always felt that every tablet device paled in comparison the the Apple suite of products.  I was wrong.  After using for only a few days I was impressed.  The graphics are amazing (resolution and pixel density). The brightness is also better than the new iPad Air.I also like the new Mayday feature.  Seriously, Apple really dropped it on this feature.  Amazon definitely put the consumers first by allowing a live video chat user like directly to customer service.  They can solve problems easily by taking over your device to make fixes.It has a great battery life and it is super fast.  I give high recommendations for the Kindle Fire.  Apple, you better watch out......

Reviews.Title: A very good tablet
Reviews.Author: Bill
Reviews.Content: I have had this tablet a little over a week.  I enjoy it more as I use it more.  I used MayDay on the first day.  It worked as advertised. I was questioning about an App that I had on the Kindle Fire HD that is not compatible to the HDX.  I was told that APPS will be worked to take advantage of the higher quality display.  That seemed to be a reasonable answer.Even though I had the Fire HD, I never used the Silk browser much at all.  I am now familiarizing myself with this browser and that is going well.  I do have a slight bluish haze on the page as I read, but I do not find it distracting.  I viewed part of an episode  of a TV  program I bought through Amazon and the picture and sound were excellent.The weight makes this tablet easy to hold.  Unless I am sitting at my desk and propping up the HDX, I will normally remove it from the Oragami case.  The case works well when I need it, though.I have the HDX chiefly because I like Immersion Reading.  It performs excellently at this task.  And the light weight makes it easy to listen/read at night.  Sound quality is excellent also.
